title: Background note on establishment of Indian Multi-Disciplinary Partnership (MDP) firms

clauses.clauseText: The global consulting and auditing industry is valued at nearly $240 billion, dominated by international networks and global strategy majors. Despite India's world-class talent pool, domestic firms remain marginal players, particularly in high-value audits and consulting, partly due to structural and regulatory barriers. [cite: 50, 51]

clauses.clauseTitle: Issues which need to be addressed to help grow Indian firms to International level
clauses.clauseText: In India, professionals such as chartered accountants, company secretaries, and lawyers face restrictions on advertising and branding due to regulations set by their governing bodies. [cite: 102, 104] [cite_start]This ban limits Indian firms from building strong brands and competing on a global scale. [cite: 106] [cite_start]Additionally, restrictions on multidisciplinary partnerships (MDPs) prevent professionals from different fields from working together under a single firm structure, limiting their ability to offer integrated services. [cite: 108, 109, 110]

Suggest specific changes in the Rules/Regulations administering different professionals in India to ensure Indian firms develop into globally competitive players in the field of consultancy. [cite: 136, 141]

title: Companies (Compromises, Arrangements and Amalgamations) Amendment Rules, 2025

clauses.clauseText: These rules may be called the Companies (Compromises, Arrangements and Amalgamations) Amendment Rules, 2025. They shall come into force on the date of their publication in the Official Gazette. [cite: 6, 7]

In the Companies (Compromises, Arrangements and Amalgamations) Rules, 2016, in Rule 25, in sub-rule (1A), in clause (ii) for the words 'small company', new clauses are substituted for mergers involving unlisted companies meeting certain criteria, a holding company and its unlisted subsidiaries, or a foreign holding company with its wholly owned Indian subsidiary. [cite: 8, 10, 14, 16]

title: Public Notice regarding amendment to Companies (Meetings of Board and its Powers) Rules, 2014
draft_text: कंपनी मामले, भारत सरकार सीएल-1 खंड नो. 1/32/2013-सीएल-वी (भाग) नई दिल्ली, 26 जून, 2025 सार्वजनिक नोटिस कंपनी अधिनियम, 2013 (अधिनियम) की धारा 186(11)(a) के तहत तथा कंपनी (बोर्ड की बैठकें और उसकी शक्तियां) नियम, 2014 के नियम 11(2) के अनुसार, आरबीआई के साथ पंजीकृत गैर-बैंकिंग वित्तीय कंपनियां (एनबीएफसी) जो ऋण देने या किसी व्यक्ति द्वारा व्यवसाय के सामान्य क्रम में लिए गए ऋण के समय पर पुनर्भुगतान के लिए गारंटी/सुरक्षा प्रदान करने के व्यवसाय में लगी हैं, अधिनियम की धारा 186 (ऐसी धारा के उप-धारा (1) को छोड़कर) की आवश्यकताओं से छूट हैं। अंतर्राष्ट्रीय वित्तीय सेवा केंद्र प्राधिकरण (आईएफएससीए) द्वारा मंत्रालय में कंपनी (बोर्ड की बैठकें और उसकी शक्तियां) नियम, 2014 के नियम 11(2) में संशोधन करने का अनुरोध किया गया था ताकि आईएफएससीए के साथ पंजीकृत "वित्त कंपनियों" को भी ऐसे नियम 11(2) के दायरे में शामिल किया जा सके, जिससे आरबीआई के साथ पंजीकृत एनबीएफसी को उपलब्ध छूट ऐसी वित्त कंपनियों को भी मिल सके। यह सुझाव आईएफएससी क्षेत्राधिकार में वित्त कंपनियों के लिए व्यवसाय में आसानी प्रदान करने के उद्देश्य से है। एमसीए ने वित्त मंत्रालय (डीईए), आरबीआई और आईएफएससीए के परामर्श से प्रस्ताव की जांच की है और कंपनी (बोर्ड की बैठकें और उसकी शक्तियां) नियम, 2014 के नियम 11(2) में संशोधन प्रस्तावित किया गया है। तदनुसार, एक अधिसूचना तैयार की गई है और मंत्रालय के ऑनलाइन पोर्टल यानी www.mca.gov.in पर उपलब्ध कराई गई है। हितधारकों से ऐसे मसौदा संशोधन पर सुझाव/टिप्पणियां आमंत्रित करने का निर्णय लिया गया है। मसौदा संशोधन अधिसूचना पर सुझाव/टिप्पणियां संक्षेप में तर्क सहित 17 जुलाई, 2025 तक कॉर्पोरेट मामलों के मंत्रालय की वेबसाइट पर ई-परामर्श मॉड्यूल के माध्यम से भेजी जा सकती हैं। भारत सरकार कंपनी मामले मंत्रालय अधिसूचना नई दिल्ली, जून, 2025 जी.एस.आर. (ई).— कंपनी अधिनियम, 2013 (2013 का 18) की धारा 469 के साथ पठित धारा 173, 177, 178 और धारा 186 द्वारा प्रदत्त शक्तियों का प्रयोग करते हुए, केंद्र सरकार कंपनी (बोर्ड की बैठकें और उसकी शक्तियां) नियम, 2014 में संशोधन करने हेतु निम्नलिखित नियम बनाती है:— (1) इन नियमों को कंपनी (बोर्ड की बैठकें और उसकी शक्तियां) संशोधन नियम, 2025 कहा जाएगा। (2) ये आधिकारिक राजपत्र में प्रकाशन की तारीख से लागू होंगे। कंपनी (बोर्ड की बैठकें और उसकी शक्तियां) नियम, 2014 में, नियम 11 के उप-नियम (2) में - (क) "shall include" शब्दों के स्थान पर "shall include - (i)" शब्द, कोष्ठक और संख्या प्रतिस्थापित की जाएगी; (ख) "ordinary course of its business" शब्दों के बाद निम्नलिखित शब्द, कोष्ठक और संख्या अंतःस्थापित की जाएगी: "and (ii)- with regard to a Finance Company registered with the International Financial Services Centres Authority, business of carrying out activity of lending in the form of loans, commitments and guarantees, credit enhancement, securitisation, financial lease, and sale and purchase of portfolios as specified in sub-clause (a), or carrying out activity of Global or Regional Corporate Treasury Centre as specified in sub-clause (e) of clause (ii) of sub-regulation (1) of regulation 5 of IFSCA (Finance Company) Regulations, 2021 in the ordinary course of its business" [एफ. नं. 1/32/2013-सीएल-वी-भाग] (बालामुरुगन डी.) भारत सरकार के संयुक्त सचिव नोट: मूल नियम भारत के राजपत्र, असाधारण, भाग II, खंड 3, उप-खंड (i) में संख्या जी.एस.आर. 240(ई), दिनांक 31 मार्च, 2014 को प्रकाशित किए गए थे और अंतिम बार अधिसूचना संख्या जी.एस.आर. 409(ई), दिनांक 15 जून, 2021 द्वारा संशोधित किए गए थे।

title: Inviting comments on draft amended Recruitment Rules for the post of Prosecutor and Senior Prosecutor in SFIO

title: Invitation of application for The Drafting Counsel / Associates on a temporary basis in the office of official liquidator, Mumbai
draft_text: GOVERNMENT OF INDIA MINISTRY OF CORPORATE AFFAIRS OFFICE OF THE OFFICIAL LIQUIDATOR, HIGH COURT, BOMBAY 5th FLOOR, BANK OF INDIA BUILDING, M. G. ROAD, FORT, MUMBAI - 400001. Telephone Nos. (Office): 2267 0024, 2267 5008. E-mail: samapakmum@yahoo.com. OL/PA/CA/CS/ICWA/LLB/ Date: - NOTICE FOR INVITATION OF APPLICATION FROM ELIGIBLE CANDIDATES FOR THE DRAFTING COUNSEL / ASSOCIATES ON A TEMPORARY BASIS IN THE OFFICE OF OFFICIAL LIQUIDATOR, MUMBAI. The earlier notice dated 24/12/2024 bearing reference OL/PA/CA/CS/ICWA/LLB/ stands withdrawn. All those who applied pursuant to the said notice are advised to apply afresh. The Official Liquidator, High Court, Bombay invites applications in a prescribed format along with bio-data/Curriculum Vitae from eligible candidates who are Advocates for Drafting Counsel and from Chartered Accountant, Company Secretary, Cost & Works Accountant for Associate on a temporary basis for tenure of 12 months and on the monthly lump-sum remuneration of Rs.50,000/- p.m subject to deduction of TDS, if any applicable. The eligible candidates shall submit their Application along with bio-data / curriculum vitae to the Official Liquidator on or before 01/06/2025. The details of the post and eligibility are given below: 1. Drafting Counsel - Qualification: LL.B - Experience: Minimum 3 years experience of Legal practice at Bar preferably with knowledge of Company Law/Corporate Laws. 2. Associate - Qualification: Chartered Accountant/Company Secretary/Cost and Work Accountant - Experience: Chartered Accountant who holds a membership of ICAI with 3 years of practice as a practicing Chartered Accountant or 3 years of job experience preferably with knowledge of Company Law/Corporate Laws. OR Company Secretary who holds a membership of ICSI with 3 years of practice as a practicing Company Secretary or 3 years of job experience preferably with knowledge of Company Law/Corporate Laws. OR Costs & Works Accountant who holds a membership of ICMAI with 3 years of practice as a practicing Cost Accountants or 3 years of job experience preferably with knowledge of Company Law/Corporate Laws. The Drafting Counsel /Associates to be appointed are expected to have good communication skills written as well as verbal, team management skill, logical reasoning, sense of responsibility, well conversant with MS-Excel, performing numerical work, having knowledge of Companies Act and Rules. Any candidate having more experience and more qualification may also apply. The candidate should submit the legible Application and Bio Data/Curriculum vitae alongwith attested copy of certificate of prescribed qualification and certificate of experience as stated above through e-mail ONLY at olmumestt_2020@yahoo.com. Misrepresentation/suppression of facts and/or submission of false/forged documents will entail action against such candidate including termination of service without any notice and remuneration paid, if any, will be recovered. The Job profile: The selected candidates shall have to work under the supervision of the Officers of the office of the Official Liquidator. Duties include: reviewing and preparing company briefs and drafting reports, replies, rejoinders, affidavits and other documents; assisting in adjudication of claims of workers/creditors and stakeholders; assisting in dividend declaration and disbursement; examining and scrutinizing Statements of Affairs; preparing half yearly statements, updating cash books manually, filing income tax returns and other accounting work; handling other liquidation proceedings; attending court matters with officers; and performing any other work as directed. SELECTION PROCESS: Applications will be scrutinized and shortlisted candidates will be intimated by email to attend the interview. Selection process involves an interview conducted by a panel presided over by a former High Court Judge and two Senior Advocates, one from Original Side and one from Appellate Side of Hon’ble High Court, Bombay, or as directed by Hon’ble Company Court. No intimation will be sent to unshortlisted candidates. The panel’s decision shall be final. Dated this 5th day of May, 2025. OFFICIAL LIQUIDATOR, HIGH COURT, BOMBAY. TERMS AND CONDITIONS: I. Drafting Counsel/Associate shall attend office as required, may take private assignments provided these do not conflict with duties. II. Perform work assigned by the Official Liquidator or authorized officer. III. Public holidays applicable unless instructed otherwise. IV. Services may be terminated if absent 2 consecutive days or 3 days in a month without approval, performance unsatisfactory, or other reasons. V. Remuneration: Rs.50,000/- per month subject to TDS. VI. Tenure: 12 months from date of appointment. VII. Either side may terminate with one month’s notice. VIII. Must maintain dignity and decorum. IX. Must not disclose office information
